relevant_findings.facial_weakness: Prominent facial weakness with an open mouth and high arched palate, immobile soft palate, extremely nasal and dysarthric speech, inability to whistle or blow cheeks

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially presented with neonatal hypotonia and poor spontaneous movements. Facial weakness and feeding difficulties persisted but limb muscle strength and DTRs were normal at age 5.
AChR antibodies were negative when he was 3 years old. Oral pyridostigmine failed to improve his condition.

relevant_findings.facial_nerves: CMAPs were abnormally low (0.2 mV; normal: >2 mV) when the facial nerve was stimulated
relevant_findings.absence_of_decrement: No decrement on repetitive nerve stimulation

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The facial muscle response showed low amplitude consistent with a myogenic process.
